reviews.review_msg: The most gross prof I have ever seen. Nils bruin was not raised well. He always makes weird noises when he teaches, it's super disgusting the noises he makes, never take a course with nils

For someones who's very bad at teaching, he gives very hard exams.
Man will give a very difficult question on an exam, and yet he can't even teach a simple example.
I've never meant someone who is soooo not meant to teach more then nils.

Better than 151, still not that good. Pos: adjusted grade criteria for covid, quizes bit more friendly than 151. Neg: Weekly quiz, lectures suck (s.o to YT videos instead), weekly homework, ta marking kinda inconsistent, lied about a few expected things for final exam. 

Didn't stress-cry after the final so could have been worse, really 1.5/2 @best
you will need to learn from external sources. Beware of difficult questions on exams

Easily the worst professor of all time. It seems he doesn't know what he's teaching half the time, rambles, doesn't finish material. Makes a several mistakes a lecture, and though it is funny to watch him sweat, you'll also watch your GPA plunder.

nils bruin is the worst of worst profs. this guy cannot stop stuttering and making mistakes during lectures. its ridiculous how a prof needs to have his goof ups be corrected by students during lectures! you don't learn anything from bruin's lectures because he cannot formulate sentences, stutters repeatedly, and his explanations are nonexistent

Nils Bruin is quite frankly the second coming of Jesus Christ. His lectures bring me to tears nearly every time, as I am so astounded by his magnificent glory. Nils Bruin is miles better than any other prof at SFU. Take a class with Nils Bruin if you can, you won't regret it!!!
All you need to know is he straight up put 1/2 + 1/3 behind 1/2 + 1/3 - 1/4 on a number line.
attendence in bruin's lectures is so paltry and you can see the sadness in bruin cuz no one comes to his lectures because he teaches so bad

This man is the wost teacher I have ever had. He doesn't explain what he's doing in class to solve problems rather opting to solve a bunch of problems as fast as he can. If you get this guy just watch the Jamie Mulholland videos instead because you will fail if you try to rely on his teaching.

By far one of the worst teachers I have ever had. He know his stuff but has no idea how to teach. He just copie his notes directly onto the display, and if someone asks a question or corrects him (which happens often) he gets confused and flustered.  Up until taking this class, I had never failed a test or a class before. Now I've done both. AVOID

Dr. Jungic truly has a passion for teaching math, and his love of his chosen subject area is contagious. Although the course I took with him was challenging, his humour and desire to help his students succeed made the course enjoyable. Aside from his sometimes confusing explainations, hes a great prof who wants the best for his students.
